properties.areaDesc: Santa Fe Metro Area; Estancia Valley; Middle Rio Grande Valley/Albuquerque Metro Area; Sandia/Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Espanola Valley; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 4 at 8:21AM MST until February 4 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...MORE SNOW EXPECTED FOR CENTRAL AND EASTERN NEW MEXICO...

.A storm system will bring wintry weather to much of central and
eastern New Mexico through at least this evening. Up to 8 inches
of snowfall is possible across the peaks and west facing slopes
while up to 4 inches could fall in the high valleys, eastern
highlands and plains. Temperatures will stay below freezing today
which will cause roadways to become icy and snowpacked, especially
along the I-25 corridor from Las Vegas to Raton Pass as well as
mountain passes and I-40 from the east mountain communities to the
Texas border.

* WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches.
Most of the accumulating snow in the Albuquerque Metro will be
in the eastern foothills.

* WHERE...Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass, Espanola
Valley, Santa Fe Metro Area, Middle Rio Grande Valley
including the Albuquerque Metro Area, Sandia and Manzano
Mountains including Edgewood and Estancia Valley.

* WHEN...Until 8 PM MST this evening.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery to icy road conditions.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of falling and blowing
snow may reduce visibility below 2 miles.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING
